item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 19, 2024 at 2:55 AM UTC
item.description:
1. There's No Such Thing as Software Productivity (2012) (44 points | 24 comments)

3. Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in minimal intelligence (42 points | 2 comments)
4. Embedding Lua in Sqleibniz with Rust (25 points | discuss)

9. The RAM Myth (34 points | 9 comments)
10. Updates to H-1B (260 points | 729 comments)
11. The unbearable slowness of being: Why do we live at 10 bits/s? (249 points | 277 comments)
12. Our brains create mental "chapters" with new event segmentation study (14 points | 2 comments)
13. Windshield pitting incidents in Washington reach fever pitch on April 15, 1954 (2003) (250 points | 177 comments)
14. The moonbit compiler is available on GitHub (14 points | 6 comments)
15. Java in the Small (198 points | 134 comments)
16. Corvus Robotics (YC S18) is hiring a Head of Software to help inventory drones ( | hide)

21. Formally Modeling Dreidel, the Sequel (77 points | 22 comments)
22. Advanced Civilizations Could Be Indistinguishable from Nature (24 points | 8 comments)
23. Consider the Shipwreck: Ten Books on Maritime Disasters and Ecological Collapse (10 points | discuss)
24. CDC confirms first severe human case of bird flu in U.S. (146 points | 40 comments)
25. Moon (2824 points | 235 comments)
26. On-silicon real-time AI compute governance from Nvidia, Intel, EQTY Labs (29 points | 22 comments)
27. Show HN: K8s Cleaner – Roomba for Kubernetes (55 points | 41 comments)
28. BlackSheep: Fast ASGI web framework for Python (41 points | 24 comments)
29. Saturn's rings could be much older than scientists first thought (16 points | 3 comments)
